Method Detail

fileSystemObjectsExist

public static boolean fileSystemObjectsExist(String host,
                                             String username,
                                             String password,
                                             String keyFile,
                                             List<String> fileSystemObjects,
                                             FileTransferModes fileTransferMode,
                                             boolean allMustExist)
                                      throws IOException
Checks whether the files or folders exist on a remote host. The returned value depends on the last parameter - "allMustExist". If allMustExist is True the returned value is True only if all listed objects exist. If allMustExist is False, the returned value is True if at least one object exists.

Parameters:
host - The host to connect to
username - The name of the user that deletes the file/folder
password - The password of the above user
keyFile - The key file, if used
fileSystemObjects - The files or folders to delete
fileTransferMode - SCP for secure copy in Linux, or CIFS for windows file sharing
allMustExist - If set to True the function will return True only if all listed objects exist. If set to False, the function will return True if at least one object exists.
Returns:
depends on allMustExist
Throws:
IOException - Indicates the deletion failed

deleteFileSystemObjects

public static void deleteFileSystemObjects(String host,
                                           String username,
                                           String password,
                                           String keyFile,
                                           List<String> fileSystemObjects,
                                           FileTransferModes fileTransferMode)
                                    throws IOException
Deletes files or folders on a remote host.

Parameters:
host - The host to connect to
username - The name of the user that deletes the file/folder
password - The password of the above user
keyFile - The key file, if used
fileSystemObjects - The files or folders to delete
fileTransferMode - SCP for secure copy in Linux, or CIFS for windows file sharing
Throws:
IOException - Indicates the deletion failed

createUniqueFolderName

public static String createUniqueFolderName(File parentFolder,
                                            String basicFolderName,
                                            int maxAppender)
                                     throws IOException
Creates a folder a unique name based on the given basicFolderName, inside the specified parent folder. If the folder by that name already exists in the parent folder - a number is appended to that name, until a unique name is found. e.g.: "myfolder1", "myfolder2" ... "myfolder99" (max index is set by maxAppender). If all those names are already in use (meaning there are existing folders with these names) - we create a completely new random name using "File.createTempFile".

Parameters:
parentFolder - The folder to contain the new folder created by this method.
basicFolderName - The base name to be used for the new folder. Numbers might be appended to this name to reach uniqueness.
maxAppender - The maximum number appended to the basic folder name to reach uniqueness. If a unique name is not found for the folder and the maximum is reached, a new random name using "File.createTempFile".
Returns:
The unique name
Throws:
IOException - Indicates a failure to generate a unique folder name
